abstract: Concurrent visits to Martha's Vineyard by Hillary Clinton and Pres Obama set the stage for an awkward encounter days after Clinton publicly criticized Obama's foreign policy; Obama aides dismiss notion that there is strain between Obama and Clinton, and say it is natural for Clinton to stake out her own positions.
lead_paragraph: As Hillary Rodham Clinton met admirers on Martha’s Vineyard, she also faced a tense political moment with President Obama, whose orbit she has moved away from.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR, JONATHAN MARTIN and AMY CHOZICK
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Vineyard Haven, Jonathan Martin from Washington, and Amy Chozick from New York. Mark Landler contributed reporting from Topsail Island, N.C.

headline.main: Is This Island Big Enough for Clinton and Obama?
headline.print_headline: Is This Island Big Enough for Clinton and Obama?

snippet: As Hillary Rodham Clinton met admirers on Martha’s Vineyard, she also faced a tense political moment with President Obama, whose orbit she has moved away from....
